dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 5013 IH: AUKUS Improvement Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Amo (for himself, Mr. McCaul, Mr. Courtney, Ms. McBride, and Mr. Zinke) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To make improvements to the AUKUS partnership, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the AUKUS Improvement Act of 2025.

section.header: Flexibility with respect to certain Arms Export control Act and other arms transfer requirements
section.text: Section 38(l) of the Arms Export Control Act (22 U.S.C. 2778(l)) is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

subparagraph.text: Defense articles sold by the United States under this Act may be reexported, retransferred or temporarily imported exclusively between the Government of Australia, the Government of the United Kingdom, or entities eligible under section 126.7(b)(2) of title 22 of the Code of Federal Regulations, or successor regulations. Such transfers shall not require the consent of the President under section 3(a)(2) of this Act, or under section 505(a)(1) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 (22 U.S.C. 2314(a)(1)(B)).

Intra-company, intra-organization, and intra-governmental transfers related to defense articles and defense services described under subparagraph (A) are authorized between officers, employees, and agents who satisfy section 120.64 of title 22 of the Code of Federal Regulations, or successor regulations, including dual or third country nationals who satisfy section 126.18 of title 22 of the Code of Federal Regulations, or successor regulations.

section.header: Elimination of certification requirement for commercial technical assistance or manufacturing license agreements involving Australia and the United Kingdom
section.text: Section 36(d)(2) of the Arms Export Control Act (22 U.S.C. 2776(d)(2)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: by redesignating subparagraphs (A) and (B) as clauses (i) and (ii), respectively;
by striking A certification and inserting (A) A certification;

in clause (i), as redesignated by paragraph (1), by striking North Atlantic Treaty Organization or Australia, Japan and inserting North Atlantic Treaty Organization (excluding the United Kingdom) or Japan; and
by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: A certification under this subsection shall not be required in the case of an agreement for or in Australia or the United Kingdom.
